questions.q: Will adapters work across different websites?
questions.a: No, adapters are domain-specific. Each website needs its own adapter based on its HTML structure.

questions.q: What happens if an adapter fails?
questions.a: The system automatically falls back to default HTML scraping. Adapters enhance but never break the default behavior.

questions.q: Can I share adapters with other users?
questions.a: You can copy the adapter JSON, but it may not work on other instances if website structures differ or if the website serves different content.

questions.q: How often should I update adapters?
questions.a: If websites change their structure, discover fresh adapters. Old adapters are kept for backward compatibility but may become unreliable.

questions.q: Why is JavaScript discovery so slow?
questions.a: JavaScript discovery launches a real browser (Chromium) to render JavaScript dynamically, which takes 3-5 seconds per page.

questions.q: Can adapters break my default scraping?
questions.a: No, adapters only enhance scraping. If an adapter fails, the system falls back to default scraping automatically.
80% or higher is considered good. Scores below 70% indicate less reliable detection and may require manual verification.

questions.q: How are PDFs matched to domains?
questions.a: The system extracts the domain name from the URL and checks if a matching adapter exists. Subdomains are matched to parent domain adapters.

glossary.adapter: A configuration that teaches the system how to find PDFs on a specific website
glossary.confidence: A score (0-1) indicating how certain the system is about finding PDFs correctly
glossary.selector: A CSS selector like 'a[href*=".pdf"]' that identifies PDF links in HTML
glossary.pattern: A regex pattern that matches PDF URLs, like '/pdf/page\d+\.pdf'
glossary.scraping: Automatically extracting data (PDFs in this case) from websites
glossary.fallback: The default scraping method used when adapters aren't available or fail
glossary.deduplicate: Remove duplicate URLs to get a clean list of unique PDFs
